concise_definition: v. 坚持, 持续, 坚持不懈 (persist 的过去式和过去分词)

definitions.explanation_en: To continue firmly or obstinately in a course of action, belief, or state despite difficulty, opposition, or discouragement.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在面对困难、反对或挫折时，仍坚定地坚持某种行为、信念或状态。
definitions.example_en: She persisted in her efforts to learn the piano, even after months of little progress.
definitions.example_cn: 即使几个月来进步甚微，她仍坚持不懈地练习钢琴。

definitions.explanation_en: To continue to exist or remain in a particular state over a long period of time, often despite attempts to remove or change it.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指某种状态、问题或现象长期持续存在，即使有消除或改变它的努力。
definitions.example_en: The smell of smoke persisted in the room even after the fire was extinguished.
definitions.example_cn: 即使火被扑灭后，房间里的烟味依然久久不散。

definitions.explanation_en: To endure or last through time, especially in a way that is noticeable or remarkable.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在时间中持续存在，尤其指这种持续具有显著性或令人印象深刻。
definitions.example_en: His legacy persisted long after his death, influencing generations of artists.
definitions.example_cn: 他的遗产在他去世后仍长久留存，影响了数代艺术家。

comparison.analysis: “Continue” (继续) 是一个中性词，仅表示某事没有中断，不带有情感或意志色彩。而 “persisted” 强调在面对阻力或不利条件时仍坚持，隐含决心、毅力甚至固执的意味。
“Endure” (忍受) 更侧重于被动承受痛苦、困难或不愉快的事物，强调忍耐力。而 “persisted” 更强调主动的、有意识的坚持，即使环境不利也不放弃。
“Last” (持续) 通常指时间上的延续，是客观描述，不涉及主观意愿。例如，电池能持续多久。而 “persisted” 常用于描述一种状态或行为因意志力而顽强存在，带有更强的动态性和情感色彩。
